reviewText:
Here is the second edition of Randolph Scott Westerns, "exclusively licensed for distribution from Sony Pictures Home Ent." by Mill Creek. All six films were previously released on DVD and "The Nevadan" was previously on MOD DVD. There are two disks with three films on each and the quality of the films are quite good. There are no bonus features, subtitles or any other audio except for English Dolby Digital 2.0, also each film only has five chapters.

All films are in color and are in Full-screen format, 1.33:1.
(Disc 1)
"The Desperadoes" (1943/87mins.)
-Glenn Ford, Randolph Scott, Claire Trevor, Evelyn Keyes; Directed by Charles Vidor
"The Nevadan" (1950/81mins.)
-Randolph Scott, Dorothy Malone, Forrest Tucker, Frank Faylen; Directed by Gordon Douglas
"Santa Fe" (1951/87mins.)
-Randolph Scott, Janis Carter, Jerome Courtland, John Archer; Directed by Irving Pichel
(Disc 2)
"Man in the Saddle" (1951/87mins.)
-Randolph Scott, Joan Leslie, Ellen Drew, Alexander Knox, John Russell; Directed by Andre de Toth
"Hangman's Knot" (1952/82mins.)
-Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Claude Jarman Jr., Frank Faylen, Lee Marvin; Directed by Roy Huggins
"The Stranger Wore a Gun" (1953/83mins.)
-Randolph Scott, Claire Trevor, Joan Weldon, George Macready; Directed by Andre de Toth

Overall this is a great collection of Westerns and I would recommend this. I would also recommend this if you need to free up DVD space, that's why I made my purchase.
If you like Randolph Scott or just older westerns this is one to get. Transfer quality is very good.
This was purchased for my husband and he is very happy with it.
PERFECT AND GREAT DVD.
Great old Randolph Scott films.  I keep buying more as I find them.  Great fun to watch!

I ordered this because I really like Randolph Scott as a western actor.  I really liked volume 1 and so I ordered volume 2.  The quality of the cinematography is quite good, but the films are too hokey--even for me.  These were clearly earlier in his career and too many aspects were just too silly.  A couple of notches above Roy Rogers.
Anything Randolph Scott is in I will watch.
Randolf Scott as his typical greatness. Westerns with a complex plot. Whatever happened to Randolf Scott, happened to the best of me.
Great Scott

I am not a fan of westerns having seen too many of those as a kid. But I have always admired Randolph Scott and the films here are wonderful westerns, each with a unique story and played very well by all of the characters with great color. Very well done.
We have really enjoyed the movies we have seen on these DVDs.  Randolph Scott was a great actor.
perfect

When I was a kid (many, many moons ago) Randolph Scott was my favorite actor.  So I couldn't resist ordering this set of movies.  A little out of touch with current, modernized westerns, but still good to see, just need to take a break between movies.
Some of the best of Randolph Scott's best westerns.  Glad to add this to my library of westerns.

Wow! This is deal. It comes with 2 disks, single sided, with 3 movies on both. All the movies are very good. The technicolor and screen image is excellent. For about $9 you get 6 good westerns for $1.50 each. I think they are all from Columbia. I think it is fun watching movies from the same artist. I recently watched James Stewart movies which were excellent that few know about.

This is an excellent package. The best ones are Hangman's Knot and The Desperadoes. The othres are a bit predictable and there is a lot riding here and there, which is often great to watch, but sometimes a bit irrelevant for the story. Randolph Scott is always exellent and raises the level of these films. He is so perfect in these kind of westerns. Of course the Boetticher directed films are better, but these are watchable, too.
Good Randolph Scott westerns.  Mr. Scott's fans should enjoy these films.
Loved these Movies
Arrived fast.  Randolph Scott is still a real hero.

If you're a western fan, or a Randolph Scott fan, you'll love this set of movies.  The reproduction is very good. All filming and sound is very good!  It is typical Randolph Scott stuff.  I buy all I can get from him.  This set was a lot of fun!
Any Randolph Scott western is a fave star treat. As an old fan it was fun to relive the days past at the neighborhood movie house on a saturday with the old gang.

good
Great for my Western collection, especially old Westerns.
great
Received yesterday,watched The Nevadan today and The Stranger wore a gun last night. Both good films. DVD well protected,great condition good collection of Westerns.

I only recently began viewing Scott's westerns, not really knowing they existed. They would have been new in the theaters when I was growing up and as a teenager, but never paid any attention to them at the time, which was rather unnatural because my sister and I attended Saturday matinees for most of the fifties and a lot of those were westerns. Now here I am watching these great movies and enjoying Scott's portrayals like no other that I know of. Wayne had his way of doing it and so did many other western stars, but I feel Scott's were rather unique in that they were a "thinking" mans way of doing it. He had his way at looking at things and acting upon them which I find different from the others and really enjoy his movies. It gave me something to think about after watching the film. Not all are of the same caliber, but many I will watch again and again. The Nevadan, Decision At Sundown, Colt .45, Rage at Dawn are the ones I have enjoyed the most.
Found this on Amazon and purchased for under $10.00. The quality of the films was very good and I was very pleased with the purchase.  If you are a Randolph Scott fan, these films are a must have.
Big fan of Randolph Scott.  Great DVD to add to my western movies collection.
Great deal very happy.
Randolph Scott is one of best western actors ever.
Great

Haven't opened this box set as yet but have seen these movies before. I have most of these movies except the Nevadan. It was cheaper to buy this set instead of buying it by itself. Randolph Scott is always great in westerns.

I really like Randolph Scott westerns.  He always played a great western character. He was made to be in westerns, even a couple that may not have been top westerns, he made them better with him in the movie.

Just in case you're confused, Mill Creek has released two DVD sets bearing the same title The Randolph Scott Round-Up. The first set not marked Volume One  available elsewhere on Amazon, consists of 1955 - A Lawless Street (Technicolor. Joseph H. Lewis, director) 1.37:1 1957 - The Tall T (Technicolor. Budd Boetticher, director) 1.85:1 1957 - Decision At Sundown (Technicolor. Budd Boetticher, director) 1.85:1 1958 - Buchanan Rides Alone (Columbia Color. Budd Boetticher, director) 1.85:1 1959 - Ride Lonesome (Eastman Color. Budd Boetticher, director) 2.35:1 1960 - Comanche Station (Eastman Color. Budd Boetticher, director) 2.35:1 The second set not marked Volume Two being discussed here, consists of 1943 -- The Desperadoes (Technicolor. Charles Vidor, director) 1950 -- The Nevadan (Cinecolor. Gordon Douglas, director) 1951 -- Santa Fe (Technicolor. Irving Pichel, director) 1951 -- Man in the Saddle (Technicolor. Andr de Toth, director) 1952 -- Hangman's Knot (Technicolor. Roy Huggins, director) 1953 -- Stranger Wore A Gun (Technicolor. Andr de Toth, director) The last was filmed in stereo, widescreen (1.85:1), 3D -- presented here in mono, standard academy ratio, and flat. Once again, Columbia/Sony/Mill Creek has spared NO expense on the transfers -- there are NO anamorphic enhancements, NO subtitles/captions, NO trailers, NO commentaries, NO language options, NO menu chapter stops, NO liner notes, NO extras, NO nothing besides the films. But again, at least we have the films at a most reasonable price -- but I would gladly pay a premium for fresh, higher quality scans and much needed restorative work. Image quality appears the same as the previously released individual titles. There is substantial room for image improvement all around. These films *deserve* to be remastered from the original camera negatives, or tri-color separations, and released on Blu-ray. Most of these were "Color by Technicolor" when those words actually meant the finest and most accurate color and image quality available! Cinecolor was a two-color, low cost competitor to Technicolor -- not bad but not great. Audio quality is clean mono with dialog never buried in the mix. Subtitles are missed. Menu is *bare* bones. This time generic font is used for the film titles on the discs. Click on a title and the film begins. Packaging. The cover front and back are very good. The cover is attractive and highlights the fact that the star of these films is Randolph Scott. The back cover has thumbnails of the original posters that were used on the American posters and individual Sony-release DVDs. The discs themselves are black-labeled with undersized film titles and an undersized Columbia logo -- topped by an ill-placed Mill Creek ad at the top of each disc. Entertainment. These films range from pretty good to excellent. There's not a dud in the group -- my personal favorite being "Hangman's Knot". Final thoughts. Despite my complaints, this is another outstanding set at a great price. I'm glad to have it until Columbia/Sony does it right on Blu-ray.

When I was boyhood, Randolph Scott is one of my hero. He is tall, impressive character, trustworthy persona.
